[[File:Václav Klaus Praha 2015 (5).JPG|thumb|Václav Klaus]] In [[Politics of the Czech Republic|Czech politics]], '''Klausism''' refers to the political positions of [[Václav Klaus]], former prime minister and president of the Czech Republic. It was first used by [[Mirek Topolánek]], who designated Klausism as the ideology of the [[Civic Democratic Party (Czech Republic)|Civic Democratic Party]] (ODS).<ref>{{cite web|last1=Schoulová|first1=Petra|title=MIrek Topolánek: Nezměníme ideologii, máme klausismus|url=http://ihned.cz/c1-12023170-mirek-topolanek-nezmenime-ideologii-mame-klausismus|website=Hospodářské noviny|accessdate=9 March 2017|language=cs-CZ|date=16 December 2002|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170312042459/http://ihned.cz/c1-12023170-mirek-topolanek-nezmenime-ideologii-mame-klausismus|archivedate=12 March 2017|df=}}</ref><ref name="blog.aktualne.cz">{{cite web|title=Jiří Pehe » Homosexualismus a klausismus|url=http://blog.aktualne.cz/blogy/jiri-pehe.php?itemid=13895|website=Aktuálně.cz - Víte, co se právě děje|accessdate=9 March 2017|language=cs|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170312040456/http://blog.aktualne.cz/blogy/jiri-pehe.php?itemid=13895|archivedate=12 March 2017|df=}}</ref><ref name="Europe Intelligence Wire">{{cite web|title=ODS does not need new ideology, it has its Klausism - Topolanek |url=http://www.accessmylibrary.com/coms2/summary_0286-9967063_ITM |website=Access Library |publisher=Europe Intelligence Wire |accessdate=9 March 2017 |deadurl=bot: unknown |archive-url=https://archive.is/20120529202628/www.accessmylibrary.com/coms2/summary_0286-9967063_ITM |archivedate=29 May 2012 |df= }}</ref> This term was also used by former Prague mayor [[Jan Kasl]].<ref name="Česká redakce">{{cite web|title=Česká redakce|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/czech/interview/021216_klaus.shtml|website=www.bbc.co.uk|accessdate=9 March 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151219235235/http://www.bbc.co.uk/czech/interview/021216_klaus.shtml|archivedate=19 December 2015|df=}}</ref> Klaus himself does not take issue with the term.<ref name="zpravy.idnes.cz">{{cite web|title=Vyprázdněná politika je příležitost pro "havlismus", říká Václav Klaus|url=http://zpravy.idnes.cz/vyprazdnena-politika-je-prilezitost-pro-havlismus-rika-vaclav-klaus-126-/domaci.aspx?c=A091115_200740_domaci_vel|website=iDNES.cz|accessdate=9 March 2017|date=16 November 2009|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170312043628/http://zpravy.idnes.cz/vyprazdnena-politika-je-prilezitost-pro-havlismus-rika-vaclav-klaus-126-/domaci.aspx?c=A091115_200740_domaci_vel|archivedate=12 March 2017|df=}}</ref> The current usage of the term "Klausism" has become distanced from Klaus himself, leading to the phrase "Klausism without Klaus."<ref name="zpravy.idnes.cz"/><ref>{{cite web|title=Fischer in HN: Klaus's intellectual legacy to affect society {{!}} Prague… |url=http://praguemonitor.com/2011/01/14/fischer-hn-klauss-intellectual-legacy-affect-society |website=archive.is |accessdate=9 March 2017 |date=29 May 2012 |deadurl=bot: unknown |archive-url=https://archive.is/20120529202629/praguemonitor.com/2011/01/14/fischer-hn-klauss-intellectual-legacy-affect-society |archivedate=29 May 2012 |df= }}</ref> Though Klausism primarily refers to the political ideology, it is also frequently used as a label for the [[neologism]]s invented by Klaus.
Klaus himself used the term "Mental Scheme of ODS", which he allegedly invented by chance.<ref name="blog.aktualne.cz"/><ref name="Europe Intelligence Wire"/> This term was also used by Jan Kasl.<ref name="Česká redakce"/><ref>{{cite web|last1=Klaus|first1=Václav|title=Komu překáží myšlenkové schéma ODS? {{!}} Václav Klaus|url=https://www.klaus.cz/clanky/1203|website=www.klaus.cz|accessdate=4 April 2017|language=cs|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170404221027/https://www.klaus.cz/clanky/1203|archivedate=4 April 2017|df=}}</ref>
==Political positions== Klaus is known for his [[Euroscepticism in the Czech Republic|Euroscepticism]], [[Climate change denial|global warming denial]], [[Anti-LGBT rhetoric|opposition to homosexuality]] and [[anti-immigration|immigration]], and support of [[free market]] [[capitalism]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Radio Prague - A decade with President Václav Klaus|url=http://www.radio.cz/en/section/special/a-decade-with-president-vaclav-klaus|website=Radio.cz|accessdate=9 March 2017|language=en|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160609211701/http://www.radio.cz/en/section/special/a-decade-with-president-vaclav-klaus|archivedate=9 June 2016|df=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Karel Hvížďala » Nebojme se Klause, ale klausismu|url=http://blog.aktualne.cz/blogy/karel-hvizdala.php?itemid=13918|website=Aktuálně.cz - Víte, co se právě děje|accessdate=9 March 2017|language=cs|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170312034501/http://blog.aktualne.cz/blogy/karel-hvizdala.php?itemid=13918|archivedate=12 March 2017|df=}}</ref> Klaus's stances are often described as [[Liberal conservatism|liberal conservative]] combined with [[national liberalism]] and [[Czech nationalism]]. Jan Pauer described Klaus's political ideology as a combination of "[[Milton Friedman|Friedman]]ite [[monetarism]], [[Margaret Thatcher|Thatcher]]ite economic [[libertarianism]], Czech [[national conservatism]] and leadership pragmatism." Klaus described himself as [[Liberalism|liberal]], [[conservative]], and [[Pragmatism|pragmatic]].<ref>{{cite book|last1=Nagle|first1=John D.|last2=Mahr|first2=Alison|title=Democracy and democratization : post-communist Europe in comparative perspective|date=1999|publisher=Sage|location=London|isbn=0-7619-5679-4|page=188|url=https://books.google.cz/books?id=RLRuXV9vjswC&pg=PA188&lpg=PA188&dq=v%C3%A1clav+klaus+conservatism&source=bl&ots=8yjZxNTt09&sig=eu9KigrBpU6ftFQaTrMapX7VbhY&hl=cs&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwi9yObx_8nSAhUC1hoKHYTwAhcQ6AEIIzAC#v=onepage&q=v%C3%A1clav%20klaus%20conservatism&f=false|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170312041253/https://books.google.cz/books?id=RLRuXV9vjswC&pg=PA188&lpg=PA188&dq=v%C3%A1clav+klaus+conservatism&source=bl&ots=8yjZxNTt09&sig=eu9KigrBpU6ftFQaTrMapX7VbhY&hl=cs&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwi9yObx_8nSAhUC1hoKHYTwAhcQ6AEIIzAC#v=onepage&q=v%C3%A1clav%20klaus%20conservatism&f=false|archivedate=2017-03-12|df=}}</ref>
Bohumil Doležal believes that Klausism is about "fighting against isms," including environmentalism, [[pro-Europeanism]], [[Non-governmental organization|NGOism]] or "[[homosexuality|homosexualism]]" (a phrase itself coined by Klaus). It is opposition to perceived trends in Western politics. Klausism is, according to Doležal, a fight for "realistic policies that solve problems and do not serve dogmatic ideologies". Doležal stated that Klausism itself became one of these Isms.<ref name="Čas falešných proroků">{{cite web|last1=Doležal|first1=Bohumil|title=Čas falešných proroků|url=http://neviditelnypes.lidohttps://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Klausism&action=edit#vky.cz/udalosti-cas-falesnych-proroku-d3i-/p_politika.aspx?c=A110815_231944_p_politika_wag|website=Lidovky.cz|accessdate=2 April 2017|date=17 August 2011}}</ref>
In 2011, ''Ekonom'' Magazine likened Klausism to [[Gaullism]], asserting that the two were very similar. Both ideologies support the strong position of the president, but in the case of Klaus it is informal and balancing at the edge of the Czech constitution.<ref name="Klausismus podle vzoru gaullismus">{{cite web|last1=Břešťan|first1=Robert|title=Klausismus podle vzoru gaullismus|url=http://ekonom.ihned.cz/c1-51698870-klausismus-podle-vzoru-gaullismus|website=Týdeník Ekonom|accessdate=2 April 2017|language=cs-CZ|date=28 April 2011|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170403015029/http://ekonom.ihned.cz/c1-51698870-klausismus-podle-vzoru-gaullismus|archivedate=3 April 2017|df=}}</ref>
==Klausism without Klaus== Klausism without Klaus was a term coined by [[Mirek Topolánek]] following conflicts between Václav Klaus and ODS. Bohumil Doležal likened it to "[[Socialism with a human face]]".<ref name="Čas falešných proroků"/> It is often characterised as support for Klaus's ideas but not Klaus himself.<ref name="Návrat Václava Klause se odkládá">{{cite web|last1=Doležal|first1=Bohumil|title=Návrat Václava Klause se odkládá - Přítomnost.cz|url=http://www.pritomnost.cz/cz/archiv-od-roku-2012/424-navrat-vaclava-klause-se-odklada|website=www.pritomnost.cz|accessdate=2 April 2017|language=cs-cz|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170403110433/http://www.pritomnost.cz/cz/archiv-od-roku-2012/424-navrat-vaclava-klause-se-odklada|archivedate=3 April 2017|df=}}</ref> Topolánek wanted to retain the positive elements of Klaus' legacy and leave out the negatives. <!-- This sentence doesn't make sense, please clarify!!! "Zbyněk Stanislav described the concept to formality of Czech right-wing politics which he considers to be closer to petty bourgeois-ism and snobbishness than to English Conservatism". --> Klausism without Klaus was represented by [[Petr Nečas]], [[Miroslava Němcová]] and [[Tomáš Chalupa]]. Klausism without Klaus supports [[economic liberalism]], political responsibility, a small state, opposition to other ideologies and the rule of common sense.<ref name="Děti roztomilého dinosaura">{{cite web|last1=televize|first1=Česká|title=Děti roztomilého dinosaura|url=http://www.ceskatelevize.cz/ct24/nazory/1292076-deti-roztomileho-dinosaura|website=ČT24|accessdate=2 April 2017|language=cs|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170403014050/http://www.ceskatelevize.cz/ct24/nazory/1292076-deti-roztomileho-dinosaura|archivedate=3 April 2017|df=}}</ref>
==Poděbrady Articles== The term "Mental scheme of ODS" was formulated into the Poděbrady Articles in 1998,<ref name="Pětadvacet let ODS a této země">{{cite web|title=Pětadvacet let ODS a této země|url=http://www.tyden.cz/rubriky/domaci/politika/petadvacet-let-ods-a-teto-zeme_380904.html|website=Tyden.cz|accessdate=17 August 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170818044927/http://www.tyden.cz/rubriky/domaci/politika/petadvacet-let-ods-a-teto-zeme_380904.html|archivedate=18 August 2017|df=}}</ref> proclaiming the four principles that ODS supports, including protection of privacy, a small state, a future without debts, and solidarity of responsibilities.<ref name="Čtyři poděbradské artikuly">{{cite web|title=Čtyři poděbradské artikuly|url=http://www.ods.cz/docs/programy/ctyri-podebradske-artikuly-1998.pdf|website=ODS.cz|accessdate=17 August 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170818010831/http://www.ods.cz/docs/programy/ctyri-podebradske-artikuly-1998.pdf|archivedate=18 August 2017|df=}}</ref>
==Parties linked with Klausism== *[[Civic Democratic Party (Czech Republic)|Civic Democratic Party]] (ODS) - Klaus is the founder of ODS. Former leader of ODS Mirek Topolánek is the first person to use the term.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Kopecký|first1=Josef|title=Nezměníme ideologii, máme klausismus|url=http://archiv.ihned.cz/c1-12020930-nezmenime-ideologii-mame-klausismus|website=Hospodářské noviny|accessdate=9 March 2017|language=cs-CZ|date=16 December 2002|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170312042048/http://archiv.ihned.cz/c1-12020930-nezmenime-ideologii-mame-klausismus|archivedate=12 March 2017|df=}}</ref> *[[Czech Sovereignty]] (ČS) - The party is supportive of Klaus's views.<ref>{{cite web|title=Klaus se vrátí, tvrdí Bobošíková. Strana se má jmenovat SUPR|url=https://www.novinky.cz/domaci/311451-klaus-se-vrati-tvrdi-bobosikova-strana-se-ma-jmenovat-supr.html|website=Novinky.cz|accessdate=9 March 2017|language=cs-CZ|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170312070947/https://www.novinky.cz/domaci/311451-klaus-se-vrati-tvrdi-bobosikova-strana-se-ma-jmenovat-supr.html|archivedate=12 March 2017|df=}}</ref> *[[Freeholder Party of the Czech Republic]] (SsČR) - The party is close to Klaus's views.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Bartoníček|first1=Radek|title=Klaus a Valenta si notovali. Fandím lidem jako on, řekl exprezident|url=http://archiv.ihned.cz/c1-65280810-klaus-a-valenta-si-notovali-fandim-lidem-jako-on-rekl-exprezident|website=Hospodářské noviny|accessdate=10 March 2017|language=cs-CZ|date=5 May 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170312061807/http://archiv.ihned.cz/c1-65280810-klaus-a-valenta-si-notovali-fandim-lidem-jako-on-rekl-exprezident|archivedate=12 March 2017|df=}}</ref> *[[Independence Party of the Czech Republic]] (SNČR) - Party founded by strong Eurosceptic Klausist wing of the Party of Free Citizens.<ref>https://www.krajskelisty.cz/praha/16135-ceska-republika-vystoupila-z-eu-vlada-cr-dnes-odeslala-evropske-rade-dopis-byvaly-svobodny-odesel-ze-strany-a-tak-trochu-se-urval.htm</ref><ref>http://institutvk.cz/files/newslettery/74.pdf?rand=33</ref> *[[Party of Free Citizens]] (Svobodní) - The party is supportive of many Klaus's views.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Bek|first1=Lukáš|title=Novou stranu zakládají Klausovi nejbližší spolupracovníci|url=https://www.novinky.cz/domaci/158345-novou-stranu-zakladaji-klausovi-nejblizsi-spolupracovnici.html|website=Novinky.cz|accessdate=9 March 2017|language=cs-CZ|date=8 January 2009|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170312070814/https://www.novinky.cz/domaci/158345-novou-stranu-zakladaji-klausovi-nejblizsi-spolupracovnici.html|archivedate=12 March 2017|df=}}</ref> *[[Civic Conservative Party (Czech Republic)|Civic Conservative Party]] (OKS) - The party was described by sociologist Pavel Šplíchal as a dead-end branch of Klausism.<ref name="O.K., všichni jste středoleví!">{{cite web|title=O.K., všichni jste středoleví!|url=https://a2larm.cz/2013/11/o-k-vsichni-jste-stredolevi/|website=A2larm|accessdate=2 January 2018|language=cs-cz|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180103011838/https://a2larm.cz/2013/11/o-k-vsichni-jste-stredolevi/|archivedate=3 January 2018|df=}}</ref>
==Neologisms== The term Klausism is also used for neologisms coined by Václav Klaus. Klaus is noted for his use of language and often invents new words to describe things he opposes. For example, Klaus invented the word "Havlism", which subsequently entered wider use. Klaus also expressed opposition to "homosexualism". Other widely used Klausisms are ''[[Opposition Agreement]]'' or ''Sarajevo atentate''.<ref>{{cite web|title=Nový klausismus - spokojování. Podle expertky je prezident kreativní {{!}} Domov|url=http://www.lidovky.cz/klausismy-podle-jazykovedcu-je-prezident-kreativni-f9j-/zpravy-domov.aspx?c=A121118_132740_ln_domov_khu|website=Lidovky.cz|accessdate=28 March 2017|date=19 November 2012|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170821084359/http://www.lidovky.cz/klausismy-podle-jazykovedcu-je-prezident-kreativni-f9j-/zpravy-domov.aspx?c=A121118_132740_ln_domov_khu|archivedate=21 August 2017|df=}}</ref>
==Criticism== Klausism has many critics. [[Jiří Pehe]] called Klausism deviant, and its own worst enemy, noting Klausism's opposition to modern isms, a category to which Pehe believes it belongs.<ref>{{cite web|title=Jiří Pehe » Homosexualismus a klausismus|url=http://blog.aktualne.cz/blogy/jiri-pehe.php?itemid=13895|website=Aktuálně.cz - Víte, co se právě děje|accessdate=2 April 2017|language=cs|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170312040456/http://blog.aktualne.cz/blogy/jiri-pehe.php?itemid=13895|archivedate=12 March 2017|df=}}</ref> Pehe believes that Klausism is not what Klaus says but what he did when he was in power. He considers Klaus to be very politically flexible and ignorant of other opinions.<ref>{{cite web|last1=a.s.|first1=Internet servis,|title=Neviditelný pes|url=http://archiv.neviditelnypes.lidovky.cz/clanky/2003/01/27444_12_0_0.html|website=archiv.neviditelnypes.lidovky.cz|accessdate=2 April 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170403014441/http://archiv.neviditelnypes.lidovky.cz/clanky/2003/01/27444_12_0_0.html|archivedate=3 April 2017|df=}}</ref> Pehe suggested that Klausism would be doom for ODS.<ref>{{cite web|title=Jiří Pehe: Smutné výročí Občanské demokratické strany|url=http://www.rozhlas.cz/plus/nazory/_zprava/jiri-pehe-smutne-vyroci-obcanske-demokraticke-strany--1605549|website=Rozhlas.cz|accessdate=2 April 2017|language=cs|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180131201755/http://www.rozhlas.cz/plus/nazory/_zprava/jiri-pehe-smutne-vyroci-obcanske-demokraticke-strany--1605549|archivedate=31 January 2018|df=}}</ref>
The leader of the [[Green Party (Czech Republic)|Czech Green Party]] [[Ondřej Liška]] described Klausism as dangerous for democracy. He called Klausism an "ideology of arbitrariness that threatens democracy", comparing it to [[communism]] due to its, in his opinion, lack of principles.<ref>{{cite web|title=Liška (SZ): Klausismus jako ohrožení demokracie|url=http://www.parlamentnilisty.cz/politika/politici-volicum/Liska-SZ-Klausismus-jako-ohrozeni-demokracie-288964|website=Parlamentní Listy|accessdate=2 April 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170403015237/http://www.parlamentnilisty.cz/politika/politici-volicum/Liska-SZ-Klausismus-jako-ohrozeni-demokracie-288964|archivedate=3 April 2017|df=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Liška varuje před nebezpečím klausismu {{!}} EuroZprávy.cz|url=http://domaci.eurozpravy.cz/politika/79045-liska-varuje-pred-nebezpecim-klausismu/|website=Eurozprávy|accessdate=2 April 2017|language=en|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170403110609/http://domaci.eurozpravy.cz/politika/79045-liska-varuje-pred-nebezpecim-klausismu/|archivedate=3 April 2017|df=}}</ref>

{{Infobox website | name = Latma | logo = latma-logo.jpg | logo_size = 250px | logocaption = | screenshot = | collapsible = | collapsetext = | caption = | url = {{URL|www.latma.co.il}} | commercial = | type = [[Satire]] and [[News]] website | registration = | language = | num_users = | content_license = | content_licence = | programming language = | owner = Shlomo Blass | author = | editor = Caroline Glick | launch_date = December 2008 | revenue = | ip = | current_status = | footnotes = }}
'''Latma''' ({{lang-he|לאטמה}}, translation from Arabic "slap in the face") is a [[Conservatism|right-wing]]<ref>{{cite web|title=Israel's Channel 1 to broadcast right-wing satirical show|url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/national/1.624840|website=Haaretz|publisher=Haaretz Daily Newspaper Ltd.|accessdate=29 April 2015}}</ref> Israeli media criticism website that also produces a weekly satirical news show.
The website was created in 2008 by a group of journalists claiming that "the only way to improve the Public discourse is exposing the true face of the news and journalism in whole". According to the site, the majority of the Israeli media, and especially the satire that is presented in them, lean to the political left. The site contains criticism about media outlets, reporters and journalists. The criticism is mostly directed towards politically biased articles. The site's editor, [[Caroline Glick]], told the ''[[Jerusalem Post]]'' that the group was founded with the intention of using comedy to critique the "egregious leftist slant of news coverage in this country."<ref name = "JPost" />
According to ''[[The New York Times]]'', Latma "is an initiative of the [[Center for Security Policy]], a Washington think tank."<ref name="Mackey" /> The Latma website editor, [[Caroline Glick]], serves as Adjunct Senior Fellow for Middle Eastern Affairs at the Center for Security Policy.<ref>{{cite web |title=The Center for Security Policy Staff |url=https://www.centerforsecuritypolicy.org/about-us/fellows/ |publisher=''[[Center for Security Policy]]'' |accessdate=October 18, 2015}}</ref>
The site's editor is Caroline Glick. The regular writers are Shuky Blass and Avishai Ivri. The site's CEO is Shlomo Blass.
==Latma TV== LatmaTV is staffed by Tal Gil'ad (screenplay), Avishay Ivri, the editor, directors Aviv and Yoni Karsutzki, writers [[Noam Jacobson]] and Yehuda Safra, and the actors. Guest writers include Shlomi Cohen Tzemah ("Catz") and Itay Elitzur.
===The Tribal Update=== One of Latma's creations is "The Tribal Update", a mock news show, featuring anchors [[Ronit Shapira|Ronit Shapira (née Avrahamof)]] and [[Elchanan Even-Chen]]. [[CBS]] News characterizes the program as "a parody TV show — kind of like ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'''s Weekend Update." According to CBS, the anchor gravely explains, in Hebrew, that "this is the newscast that reaches conclusions long before the facts are known."<ref name="Raviv" />
===Swedish antisemitism satire=== Following the 2009 [[Aftonbladet-Israel controversy]], in which a writer for [[Sweden|Swedish]] tabloid [[Aftonbladet]] alleged that the [[Israel Defense Forces|IDF]] harvested organs of [[Palestinians]], LatmaTV produced a clip a parody on [[ABBA]]'s song "Gimme, Gimme, Gimme a Man After Midnight" entitled [http://www.wejew.com/media/6050/Abba_in_Latma_Studio/ ''Primi Primi Primitive and Phlegmatic''] in which the Swedish foreign minister sings about how primitive and cowardly he is. The clip became a hit after it was quickly picked up by the leading newspaper in Sweden, [[DN.se]], and by Swedish and Norwegian bloggers. Latma website director Shlomo Blass said, "We were surprised by how quickly the clip took-off, we must have hit a sensitive nerve".<ref name="jpost-sweden" />
===''We Con the World''=== {{main|We Con the World}} In 2010 Latma produced a [[viral video]] entitled [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FOGG_osOoVg ''We Con the World''] satirizing the political intentions of activists aboard the [[MV Mavi Marmara]], the Turkish-owned flagship that led the "blockade busting" [[Free Gaza]] flotilla.<ref name="Barrow" /><ref name="Barillas" /> The video is a parody of the 1985 song "[[We Are the World]]," by [[Michael Jackson]] and [[Lionel Richie]].<ref name="BNONews" /> Israeli Government Press Office officials accidentally sent it to a list of journalists, and three hours later sent an apology describing the emailed video as having been "inadvertently released."<ref name="BNONews" /><ref name="Algameen" /><ref name="LaStampa" /> The clip received over 3 million hits on [[YouTube]].<ref name="jpost-youtube" />
In July 2011, while the second flotilla to Gaza was planned, Latma released another parody about the flotilla: a parody of [[Beach Boys]]' song and video ''[[Fun, Fun, Fun]]'' called ''Guns, Guns, Guns'', where the flotilla sailors sing about their purpose: to bring weapons to Gaza. This video had less success than ''We Con the World''.
===''The Three Terrors''===
[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VmffgIqlAYA ''The Three Terrors''] was produced in June 2010 as a sequel to ''We Con the World.'' It features three tenors who represent Iran, Turkey and Syria and who resemble [[Mahmoud Ahmadinejad]], [[Recep Tayyip Erdoğan]] and [[Bashar Assad]] singing joyfully about using terrorism to conquer the world "from Tennessee to Teheran."<ref>CBN News: [http://blogs.cbn.com/jerusalemdateline/archive/2010/06/21/the-three-terrors.aspx The Three Terrors.] June 21, 2010.</ref>
===Other videos=== In August 2010, Latma release a parody of [[Tom Jones (singer)|Tom Jones's]] song and video "[[Sex Bomb (song)|Sex Bomb]]" called [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wuEhhPbAAdA ''The Iranian Bomb''], where a fictional Iranian Minister of Destruction sings about his plans to acquire nuclear weapons. The goal of the video is to bring worldwide attention to the [[Iranian nuclear program]].<ref name="thebomb" />
===Hakol Shafit=== In 2015, the show began to air on [[Channel 1 (Israel)|Channel 1]] under the name ''Hakol Shafit''.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/187058#.VQWmFFdMKzQ |title=Right-Wing Satire Latma Finally Reaching a TV Screen Near You |last1=Har-Zahav |first1=Nir |last2=Yashar |first2=Ari |date=November 5, 2014 |publisher=[[Arutz Sheva]] |access-date=March 15, 2015}}</ref>
==Awards== * Latma was awarded the Israel Media Watch 2011 prize, given to "organizations that made courageous, meaningful, and quality contributions to the criticism of the media in Israel". It was chosen by an online poll involving over 4,000 voters.<ref name="jpost-award" /> According to Israel Media Watch, Latma brings balance to the left-wing bias of mainstream Israeli satire.<ref name="jpost-imw" />

{{Use dmy dates|date=December 2012}} :''This article covers the pan-European political party founded by Declan Ganley in 2008. For the lobby group involved in the 2008 [[Treaty of Lisbon|Lisbon Treaty]] referendum, see the [[Libertas Institute]].'' {{Infobox European political party |name = Libertas |logo = [[File:Libertas-eu Logo.png|250px|Logo of Libertas.eu]] |party_articletitle = Libertas (lobby group) |president = [[Declan Ganley]] |foundation = {{start date|2008|10|30|df=y}}The [http://www.cro.ie/search/ CRO] entry for the Libertas Party gives these details: * Type: Company * Number: 463758 * Name: The Libertas Party Limited, * Address: Moyne Park, Tuam, County Galway, Ireland * Registered: 30 October 2008 |dissolution = September 2010 {{Cite news |url=http://www.irishtimes.com/news/in-short-1.648831 |title=Ganley's Libertas company dissolved |work=The Irish Times |date=10 September 2010 |accessdate=26 February 2014 }} |ideology = Anti-[[Treaty of Lisbon|Lisbon Treaty]] |international = |europarl = [[Europe of Freedom and Democracy]] |colours = [[Blue]], [[Gold (color)|gold]] |headquarters = Registered at Moyne Park, Tuam, County Galway, Ireland[http://www.ukdata.com/company-credit-reports/THE-LIBERTAS-PARTY-LIMITED.html "Entry for the Libertas Party Limited"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090523032036/http://www.ukdata.com/company-credit-reports/THE-LIBERTAS-PARTY-LIMITED.html |date=23 May 2009 }}, at [http://www.ukdata.com/ www.ukdata.com][http://www.solocheck.ie/FreeIrishCompanyReport?companyNumber=463758&companyName=THE+LIBERTAS+PARTY+LIMITED "Entry for the Libertas Party Limited"], at [http://www.solocheck.ie/ www.solocheck.ie]
European offices on 7th Floor, Avenue de Cortenbergh 71, Brussels 1000, Belgium[http://www.libertas.eu/contact "Contact Libertas"] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090131110819/http://www.libertas.eu/contact |date=31 January 2009 }} on the [http://www.libertas.eu www.libertas.eu] |website = [https://web.archive.org/web/20090223065257/http://www.libertas.eu/ www.libertas.eu] }} '''Libertas''' was a pan-European [[political party]] founded by [[Declan Ganley]] that took part in the [[European Parliament election, 2009]] in several member states of the European Union. It won one seat in [[France]]. ==History== ===Creation=== {{See also|Libertas Institute Limited|Twenty-eighth Amendment of the Constitution Bill, 2008 (Ireland)}} {{See also|political party at European level|}} In 2008, the [[Libertas Institute Limited]], a [[lobby group]] founded by Declan Ganley and others, advocated a "no" vote in Lisbon I, the [[Twenty-eighth Amendment of the Constitution Bill, 2008 (Ireland)|2008 referendum]] in [[Republic of Ireland|Ireland]] on the [[Treaty of Lisbon]]. Lisbon I failed. The [[referendum]] was held on 12 June 2008 {{Cite news |url=http://www.breakingnews.ie/ireland/mhojojidojau/ |title=12 June pencilled in as date for Lisbon Treaty vote |work=BreakingNews.ie |date=2 April 2008 |accessdate=2 April 2008 }} and defeated by 53.4% to 46.6%, with a turnout of 53.1%. {{cite web |url=http://www.referendum.ie/current/index.asp?ballotid=78 |title=Results received at the Central Count Centre for the Referendum on The Lisbon Treaty |date=13 June 2008 |accessdate=13 June 2008 |publisher=Referendum Returning Officer, referendum.ie |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20080619215420/http://www.referendum.ie/current/index.asp?ballotid=78 |archivedate = 19 June 2008}} Libertas held a post-referendum celebration in the Burlington Hotel in Dublin on the night of Friday, 13 June 2008.[http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/comment/article4139706.ece "Europe caught in our offside trap"], Sunday Times, 15 June 2008 Attending that celebration was Danish Eurosceptic[http://www.ceskenoviny.cz/news/index_view.php?id=354566 "Lisbon treaty to bring more power to officials-critics in Prague"], 13 January 2009, ČeskéNoviny.cz and former President of the [[EUDemocrats]][http://eudemocrats.org/eud/news.php?uid=109 "Bonde calls for Referendum in 2009"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090523080621/http://eudemocrats.org/eud/news.php?uid=109 |date=23 May 2009 }}, EUDemocrats press release, 22 July 2008 and recently retired{{cite web |author=Inbituin |url=http://eudemocrats.org/eud/news.php?uid=80 |title=Bonde's last speech in the Parliament |publisher=Eudemocrats.org |date=2008-05-13 |accessdate=2013-06-20 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120220081330/http://eudemocrats.org/eud/news.php?uid=80 |archivedate=20 February 2012 |df=dmy-all }} MEP [[Jens-Peter Bonde]], who had been a "no" campaigner during the referendum. Bonde was later cited as one of the main architects of the upgrading of Libertas to a [[political party at European level]].[http://www.euractiv.com/en/eu-elections/anti-lisbon-party-obtains-eu-recognition-funding/article-179099 "Anti-Lisbon party obtains EU recognition and funding"], EurActive.com, 3 February 2009[http://www.irishexaminer.com/irishexaminer/pages/story.aspx-qqqg=sport-qqqm=sport-qqqa=sport-qqqid=83402-qqqx=1.asp "Libertas set to emerge as political party as candidates unveiled"], 2 February 2009 On 15 July 2008, RTÉ News on Two covered Ganley's comments at [[The Heritage Foundation]] in [[Washington, D.C.]], where he stated that Libertas intended running as a political party at European level. The next day Ganley confirmed that Libertas was fundraising in order to run candidates throughout Europe in the 2009 European Parliament elections.[http://www.irishtimes.com/newspaper/ireland/2008/0716/1216073118337.html "Libertas may contest European elections"] Irish Times, 16 July 2008 On 20 September 2008, the Irish Times reported[http://www.irishtimes.com/newspaper/ireland/2008/0920/1221835126848.html "Eurosceptics to help Ganley if he is MEP candidate"], Irish Times, 20 September 2008 that Bonde and Czech president [[Václav Klaus]] pledged to help Ganley to launch Libertas. The two were later amongst the guests at a dinner hosted by Ganley at the Shelbourne Hotel in Dublin on 11 November 2008.[http://www.irishtimes.com/newspaper/opinion/2008/1113/1226408581963.html "Ganley's dinner party was a meeting of minds"] Irish Times, 13 November 2008 On 30 October 2008, Ganley registered a company based in Moyne Park, [[Tuam]], County Galway called the ''Libertas Party Limited''.[http://www.irishtimes.com/newspaper/frontpage/2008/1101/1225321623322.html "Ganley registers Libertas as a European political party" from the Irish Times, 1 November 2008] The Irish Times reported that the new party was intended to "carry on the business of a European political party". The party was publicly announced in December 2008[http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/ireland/article5338120.ece "Libertas to seek a Euro majority"], The Sunday Times, 13 December 2008 with ambitions to field up to 400 candidates and win seats in all 27 EU member states. In early 2009 Libertas applied to be recognised by the European Parliament as a political party at European level. The application was briefly successful but then suspended indefinitely amidst controversy. ===Pan-European expansion=== {{Further information|List of Libertas list candidates at the 2009 European Parliament elections}} Ganley then travelled around Europe to set up Libertas lists and parties for the [[European Parliament election, 2009]].Arnold, Bruce (2009). The Fight for Democracy – The Libertas Voice in Europe. A series of interviews with Declan Ganley by Bruce Arnold. {{ISBN|978-1-905706-18-1}}. Killynon House Books Ltd. In November 2008 Libertas opened its Brussels office.[http://www.irishtimes.com/newspaper/world/2008/1127/1227739034156.html Ganley's Brussels office opens for business] Libertas launched in France on 12 February 2009, the Netherlands on 15 April,{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m8yeGMEXzzY |title=YouTube clip of Libertas launch in Netherlands |publisher=Youtube.com |date=2009-04-16 |accessdate=2013-06-20}} followed by several other European Union member states.[http://libertas.eu/ Libertas website] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090223065257/http://libertas.eu/ |date=23 February 2009 }} On 1 May 2009, Libertas held its first pan-European party convention in Rome[http://www.libertas.eu/convention/ Libertas Party Convention, Rome] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090504073144/http://www.libertas.eu/convention/ |date=4 May 2009 }} in time for the European Parliament elections in June, when it fielded hundreds of candidates for election. ====Austria==== In Austria, ''Libertas'' was rejected by both [[Freedom Party of Austria]] (FPÖ) and [[Alliance for the Future of Austria]] (BZÖ) as well as by the independent [[Hans-Peter Martin]]. Martin announced after talks and serious considerations, that he would rather remain independent,[http://www.austriantimes.at/index.php?id=11605 "Martin stiffs Irish ´Libertas´"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110706090629/http://www.austriantimes.at/index.php?id=11605 |date= 6 July 2011 }}, 5 March 2009, from [[Austrian Times]] which he successfully did. FPÖ harshly rebuffed Ganley's advances associating his activism with an alleged American conspiracy.[http://text.ots.at/meldung.php?k=OTS_20090219_OTS0178&q=&von=20090123&bis=20090222 "Mölzer: In Österreich gibt es nur eine EU-kritische Partei, und das ist die FPÖ"]{{dead link|date=June 2013}} The initially noncommital BZÖ later also declined, preferring a loose cooperation in the [[European Parliament]].[http://derstandard.at/?url=/?id=1240549941581%26sap=2%26_pid=12769021 "BZÖ wünscht sich Kooperation mit Libertas"], [[Der Standard]], 27 April 2009 ====Bulgaria==== An electoral list called "Libertas: Free Citizens" ({{lang-bg|Либертас: Свободните граждани}}) was formed by some 30 national and local [[Non-governmental organization]].[http://www.bulgaria-news.bg/bg/news/read/1237 "ЕВРОСКЕПТИЦИТЕ ОТ „ЛИБЕРТАС" ПУСНАХА КОРЕНИ В БЪЛГАРИЯ"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090501134226/http://www.bulgaria-news.bg/bg/news/read/1237 |date= 1 May 2009 }}, 28 April 2009, from [http://www.bulgaria-news.bg http://www.bulgaria-news.bg] and [http://www.monitor.bg/article?id=197572 "Чернев отива на евровота с “Либертас""] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110706143827/http://www.monitor.bg/article?id=197572 |date= 6 July 2011 }}, 4 May 2009, from [http://www.monitor.bg http://www.monitor.bg] [[Pavel Chernev]]'s Freedom Party that had announced to join the list was repudiated by Libertas. However, the submitted list was later rejected by the Bulgarian electoral commission.[http://www.econ.bg/news/article161161/opredeliha_nomerata_na_byuletinite_za_evroizborite "Определиха номерата на бюлетините за евроизборите"], 13 May 2009, from [http://www.econ.bg/ http://www.econ.bg/] and [http://parliament.europe.bg/en/index.php?category=5&id=21487 "Ballot-paper Numbers are Now Clear"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110706142849/http://parliament.europe.bg/en/index.php?category=5&id=21487 |date=6 July 2011 }} , 13 May 2009, from [http://parliament.europe.bg http://parliament.europe.bg] An appeal filed by [[Nikolay Bliznakov]] was turned down by Bulgaria's [[Supreme Administrative Court of Bulgaria|Supreme Administrative Court]] on the grounds that the list had not proven the required deposit had not given the names of its constituent parties.[http://www.sac.government.bg/home.nsf/0/6F16D0D07F1E494C422575B70036572D "ВАС отхвърли жалбата на коалиция „Либертас: Свободните граждани" срещу решението на ЦИКЕП, с което е отказана регистрация на коалицията"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110706142953/http://www.sac.government.bg/home.nsf/0/6F16D0D07F1E494C422575B70036572D |date= 6 July 2011 }}, from [http://www.sac.government.bg/ http://www.sac.government.bg/], see also: [http://www.blitz.bg/news/article/48681 "ВАС потвърди отказа за регистрация на „Либертас: Свободните граждани"], 15 May 2009, from [http://www.blitz.bg/ http://www.blitz.bg/] In the meantime, Bulgarian businessman [[Hristo Atanassov]] founded a party under the name [[Libertas Bulgaria]] which has no connection to the pan-European Libertas network. ====Czech Republic==== Right after the preliminary rejection of the [[Lisbon Treaty]] in [[Ireland]], [[Declan Ganley]], founder of the European ''Libertas.eu'', was guest of Czech President [[Václav Klaus]]"[http://praguemonitor.com/2008/11/07/irish-receive-czech-prize-rejection-lisbon-treaty Irish receive Czech prize for rejection of Lisbon treaty] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20130201011258/http://praguemonitor.com/2008/11/07/irish-receive-czech-prize-rejection-lisbon-treaty |date=1 February 2013 }}" 6 November 2008, Prague Monitor The Czech eStat.cz civic group had ambitions to replicate Libertas's success"[http://praguemonitor.com/2008/11/07/think-tank-lisbon-treaty-brings-new-imperialism Think-tank: Lisbon Treaty brings new imperialism]" 4 November 2008, Prague Monitor and awarded the Irish electorate the Michal Tošovský Prize,{{cite web|url = http://www.mvcr.cz/mvcren/article/senat-navsteva-z-evropskeho-parlamentu.aspx |title = Senát - návštěva z Evropského parlamentu|publisher = Ministry of the Interior of the Czech Republic | format = [https://translate.google.com/translate?hl=en&js=n&u=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.mvcr.cz%2Fmvcren%2Farticle%2Fsenat-navsteva-z-evropskeho-parlamentu.aspx&sl=cs&tl=en English translation]}} picked up by Ganley in Prague on 5 November 2008. During his stay in Ireland after a state visit, Klaus visited Ganley in a private capacity and later attended the Shelbourne Hotel dinner given by Ganley for leading Eurosceptics.[http://praguemonitor.com/2008/11/11/klaus-calls-himself-eu-dissident "Klaus calls himself 'EU dissident'"] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20130131185806/http://praguemonitor.com/2008/11/11/klaus-calls-himself-eu-dissident |date=31 January 2013 }}, 11 November 2008, Prague Monitor However, Ganley's Libertas was later rejectedNew right wing party to be founded. 9 December 2008, ''Prague Monitor''.{{cite web|url= http://www.neurope.eu/articles/92024.php|title= A rocky start to a barrier-free European future|publisher= Neurope.eu|date= 19 January 2009|deadurl= yes|archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090330062728/http://www.neurope.eu/articles/92024.php|archivedate= 30 March 2009|df= dmy-all}}"[http://www.irishtimes.com/newspaper/world/2009/0112/1231515550133.html Anti-Lisbon party launches in Czech Republic]", Irish Times, Monday 12 January 2009 by the new Czech Eurosceptic party, [[Petr Mach]]'s [[Party of Free Citizens]], which was endorsed by Klaus. Additionally, the Ganley-disavowed new Czech Eurosceptic party by [[Vladimír Železný]] usurped the Libertas brand by registering itself as ''Libertas.cz''. Ganley's Libertas later claimed Železný's Libertas as an affiliate. ====Greece==== After [[Manolis Kalligiannis]] ({{lang-el|Μανώλης Καλλιγιάννης}}), President of the Greek [[Liberal Party (Greece, modern)|Liberal Party]] had attended Libertas.eu's Rome convention on 1 May 2009.[http://www.libertas.eu/en/news/9-news/289-libertas-candidates-sign-petition-for-democracy-at-rome-convention "Libertas candidates sign petition for democracy at Rome Convention"] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090607061536/http://www.libertas.eu/en/news/9-news/289-libertas-candidates-sign-petition-for-democracy-at-rome-convention |date=7 June 2009 }} Manolis Kalligiannis (Μανώλης Καλλιγιάννης, sometimes rendered in English as Emmanuel Kalligiannis), Liberal Party run for the [[European Parliament election, 2009 (Greece)|2009 European parliament election]] under a Libertas-affiliated list with the name “Κόμμα Φιλελευθέρων – Libertas.eu”.[http://www.eptanews.gr/2009/05/13/%CE%A1%CE%B5%CF%80%CE%BF%CF%81%CF%84%CE%AC%CE%B6/%CE%9F_%CE%B5%CF%85%CF%81%CF%89-%CE%BB%CF%8C%CE%B3%CE%BF%CF%82_%CF%84%CF%89%CE%BD_%CE%BA%CE%BF%CE%BC%CE%BC%CE%AC%CF%84%CF%89%CE%BD/2874.html "Ο ευρω-λόγος των κομμάτων"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110721080541/http://www.eptanews.gr/2009/05/13/%CE%A1%CE%B5%CF%80%CE%BF%CF%81%CF%84%CE%AC%CE%B6/%CE%9F_%CE%B5%CF%85%CF%81%CF%89-%CE%BB%CF%8C%CE%B3%CE%BF%CF%82_%CF%84%CF%89%CE%BD_%CE%BA%CE%BF%CE%BC%CE%BC%CE%AC%CF%84%CF%89%CE%BD/2874.html |date=21 July 2011 }}, from [http://www.eptanews.gr/ Eptanews.gr] ====Hungary==== In [[Hungary]], Libertas.eu searched for candidates in an Internet ad[http://index.hu/belfold/2009/04/28/legyen_on_is_ep-kepviselo/ "Legyen ön is EP-képviselő!: Magyarkúti Barna"], 28 April 2009 and [[Károly Lóránt]] was appointed the Hungarian representative. However, as Hungarian concerns that a disorganized EU would only serve Russian strategic interests could not be dissipated, no list was fielded on behalf of Libertas. ====Italy==== Libertas.eu announced talks with the [[Pole of Autonomy]] coalition on 30 April 2009, the day before its Rome convention,[http://www.libertas.eu/en/news/news-italy/274-libertaseu-and-lautonomia-in-discussions-to-run-together-for-european-elections-in-italy-announcement-to-be-made-at-the-first-libertas-convention-in-rome "Libertas.eu and l’Autonomia in discussions to run together for European elections in Italy: Announcement to be made at the first Libertas Convention in Rome"] undated {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090604010045/http://www.libertas.eu/en/news/news-italy/274-libertaseu-and-lautonomia-in-discussions-to-run-together-for-european-elections-in-italy-announcement-to-be-made-at-the-first-libertas-convention-in-rome |date=4 June 2009 }} which were confirmed the next day by Teodoro Buontempo, the president of [[The Right (Italy)|The Right]].[http://www.ladestranews.it/notizie-la-destra/la-destra-al-meeting-paneuropeo-libertas.html "La Destra al meeting paneuropeo Libertas"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090505175556/http://www.ladestranews.it/notizie-la-destra/la-destra-al-meeting-paneuropeo-libertas.html |date= 5 May 2009 }}, undated However, in the final candidate lists submitted in May, no candidates were fielded by Libertas.eu, neither did the Pole of Autonomy list refer to Libertas.{{cite web|url=http://www.lautonomia.it/ |title=L'Autonomia website |publisher=Lautonomia.it |date= |accessdate=2013-06-20}} ====Lithuania==== Ganley arrived in [[Vilnius]] on Tuesday 3 March 2009 to discuss terms with prospective candidates, and explore whether to establish a new Libertas party in Lithuania or change the name of an existing Lithuanian party.[http://www.euro.lt/en/news/lithuanias-membership-in-the-eu/news/5233/ "Party agitating against Lisbon Treaty seeks candidates for European Parliament elections in Lithuania"], 4 March 2009, from [http://www.euro.lt/ www.euro.lt] He did so again on Monday 24 March 2009 at a lecture at [[Vilnius University]]'s Institute of International Relations and Political Science (IIRPS, or VU Tarptautinių Santykių ir Politikos Mokslų Institutas, VU TSPMI).[http://www.balsas.lt/naujiena/245357/i-vilniu-vel-atvyksta-paneuropines-partijos-libertas-vadovas/rubrika:naujienos-lietuva-politika "Į Vilnių vėl atvyksta paneuropinės partijos „Libertas“ vadovas"], 2009.03.27 18:24, [http://www.balsas.lt/ balsas.lt], English translation here [https://translate.google.com/translate?hl=en&sl=lt&u=http://www.balsas.lt/naujiena/243166/prisikelimo-partija-rinks-pirmininka-bei-kandidatus-i-ep-rinkimus/rubrika:naujienos-lietuva-politika] On 31 March 2008, Libertas Lithuania gave a press conference.[http://www.libertas.eu/en/news/news-lithuania/182-libertas-announces-election-plans-for-lithuania Libertas announces election plans for Lithuania.] From Libertas.eu, 31 March 2009. Retrieved 31 March 2009. {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090402080538/http://www.libertas.eu/en/news/news-lithuania/182-libertas-announces-election-plans-for-lithuania |date=2 April 2009 }}[http://www.alfa.lt/straipsnis/10266529/?Paneuropines.partijos.Libertas.EP.rinkimu.sarase..Bielinis..papildyta.=2009-03-31_14-35 "Paneuropinės partijos „Libertas“ EP rinkimų sąraše – Bielinis (papildyta)"], 31 March 2009 14:35, [http://www.alfa.lt alfa.lt], English translation here [https://translate.google.com/translate?hl=en&sl=lt&u=http://www.alfa.lt/straipsnis/10266529/%3FPaneuropines.partijos.Libertas.EP.rinkimu.sarase..Bielinis..papildyta.%3D2009-03-31_14-35][http://politika.atn.lt/straipsnis/20269/prezidento-patarejas--sturmuos-europarlamenta-su-avalinsko-partija-dar-atnaujinta "Prezidento patarėjas šturmuos Europarlamentą su A.Valinsko partija (dar atnaujinta)"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110722150123/http://politika.atn.lt/straipsnis/20269/prezidento-patarejas--sturmuos-europarlamenta-su-avalinsko-partija-dar-atnaujinta|date=22 July 2011}}, 31 March 2009, [http://politika.atn.lt/ politika.atn.lt] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100226004003/http://politika.atn.lt/|date=26 February 2010}}, English translation here [https://translate.google.com/translate?hl=en&sl=lt&u=http://politika.atn.lt/straipsnis/20269/prezidento-patarejas--sturmuos-europarlamenta-su-avalinsko-partija-dar-atnaujinta] Attendees at the press conference were Ganley, lawyer {{Interlanguage link multi|Eugenija Sutkienė|lt}}, political analyst and Lithuanian presidential advisor {{Interlanguage link multi|Lauras Bielinis|lt}}, and [[National Resurrection Party|Tautos Prisikėlimo Partija]] representative {{Interlanguage link multi|Saulius Stoma|lt}}. In that press conference it was announced that the Libertas Lithuanian list would be headed by Sutkiene and would include Bielinis, and that candidates from the [[National Resurrection Party|Tautos Prisikėlimo Partija]] would stand with them under a common list, although Ganley and Stoma disagreed whether other parties would join them under that list. When asked if he had read the Lisbon Treaty, Bielinis demurred. When asked about Libertas Lithuania's funding, Ganley demurred. Bielinis planned to remain in his presidential advisory post until 7 May 2009 and take unpaid leave thereafter. Lithuanian President [[Valdas Adamkus]] disagreed and announced Bielinis' resignation the next day, 1 April 2009.[http://news.penki.lt/news.aspx?Lang=RU&Element=News&TopicID=62&IMAction=ViewArticle&ArticleID=194431 "Л. Белинис – уже не советник президента"], 1 April 2009, from [http://news.penki.lt news.penki.lt] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100428092139/http://news.penki.lt/|date=28 April 2010}}, English translation here [https://translate.google.com/translate?u=http%3A%2F%2Fnews.penki.lt%2Fnews.aspx%3FLang%3DRU%26Element%3DNews%26TopicID%3D62%26IMAction%3DViewArticle%26ArticleID%3D194431&sl=ru&tl=en] When the lists were published, neither Bielinis nor Sutkiene were on [[National Resurrection Party|Tautos Prisikėlimo Partija]]'s list.[http://vilnius.adagio4.eu/view/lt/EP_rinkimai_2009/EP_rinkimai_Lietuvoje/Partiju_sarasai.html "Kandidatų sąrašai"], from [http://vilnius.adagio4.eu/ Parlamentą"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100128033701/http://www.vrk.lt/rinkimai/404_lt/KandidatuSarasai/RinkimuOrganizacija3612.html |date=28 January 2010 }}, from While Sulík, whom Ganley had already contacted before, still didn't show much interest, [[Vladimír Palko]] (KDS) agreed to bring in their joint list with OKS into the European network.[http://www.sme.sk/c/4321858/ganley-europska-unia-je-skoro-ako-chavez.html "Ganley: Európska únia je skoro ako Chávez"], 23 February 2009[http://www.libertas.eu/en/news/news-slovakia/362-libertas-announces-alliance-in-slovakia "Libertas announces alliance in Slovakia"] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090517231610/http://www.libertas.eu/en/news/news-slovakia/362-libertas-announces-alliance-in-slovakia |date=17 May 2009 }} However, as the two partys didn't want to give up their distinct identities, they used ''Libertas'' only as supplementary brand.{{cite web|author=Ondrej Jombík |url=http://www.oks.sk/article.php?707#kandidatka |title=Koalícia KDS – OKS: Chceme združenie slobodne spolupracujúcich štátov, nie byrokratický superštát |publisher=Oks.sk |date=2009-03-31 |accessdate=2013-06-20}} ===Endgame=== Libertas fielded over 600 candidates (including substitutes), but only one was elected: [[Phillippe de Villiers]].{{cite web|last=Crosbie |first=Judith |url=http://www.europeanvoice.com/article/2009/06/libertas-s-ganley-concedes-defeat-in-irish-contest/65120.aspx |title=Libertas's Ganley concedes defeat in Irish contest |publisher=Europeanvoice.com |date= |accessdate=2013-06-20}} Although Ganley himself polled a respectable number of votes, it was not enough for him to take a seat in his constituency. Ganley requested a recount of his personal vote but still lost.[http://www.independent.ie/opinion/analysis/libertas-leader-threw-toys-out-of-election-pram-1766466.html "Libertas leader threw toys out of election pram"] from [http://www.independent.ie/ http://www.independent.ie/] Having made the promise to do so before the election, Ganley retired from politics following his defeat on 8 June 2009: the fate of the party he founded, chaired, owned and governed was left to others. However, the affiliated [[Libertas Institute (Ireland)|Libertas Institute]] did emerge again in the Republic of Ireland when the Irish government launched its re-run of the [[Lisbon Treaty]], despite its [[Twenty-eighth Amendment of the Constitution Bill, 2008 (Ireland)|defeat]] the previous year. The Libertas party, along with the other minority political groupings, such as the [[Socialist Party (Ireland)|Socialist Party]] and [[Sinn Féin]], which opposed the European Constitutional Amending Bill, were outspent and outperformed by the political proponents of the bill who [[Twenty-eighth Amendment of the Constitution of Ireland|won]] by a substantial majority. It was originally intended to be an alliance of national parties, but it was later envisaged as a single pan-European party with candidates running as individual members of Libertas. By the end of April 2009, Libertas's structure had settled into a loose association of national ''member parties'' (either new or pre-existing), with each member party adhering to a set of core principles (see below) but retaining its independence and adding on additional policies as it felt appropriate.[http://www.libertas.eu/en/news/news-estonia/270-libertas-eesti-erakond-kinnitas-europarlamendi-valimisnimekirja "Libertas Eesti Erakond kinnitas Europarlamendi valimisnimekirja"] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090503085121/http://www.libertas.eu/en/news/news-estonia/270-libertas-eesti-erakond-kinnitas-europarlamendi-valimisnimekirja |date=3 May 2009 }} undated page on [http://www.libertas.eu/ http://www.libertas.eu/] For the purposes of contending the 2009 European Parliament elections, Libertas candidates ran under ''lists'' (the lists of candidates presented to voters in a European election) branded with the Libertas identity, as exemplified by the French approach. Each list was made up of some combination of the following: *''members of member parties'' *''members of affiliate parties'' (parties that were not members of Libertas.eu but cooperated with it electorally) *''individual members'' (people who chose to join Libertas.eu as individuals). New national member parties established by Libertas had names in the "Libertas X" format, e.g. "[[Libertas Sweden]]"[http://www.libertas.eu/sweden/181-hjaelp-libertas-bli-ett-registrerat-parti "Hjälp Libertas bli ett registrerat parti"] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090227090654/http://www.libertas.eu/sweden/181-hjaelp-libertas-bli-ett-registrerat-parti |date=27 February 2009 }} 26 February 2009 from the [http://www.libertas.eu/ Libertas website] (except in the UK).The UK could not adopt a "Libertas X" format name because that name had already been registered with the Electoral Commission. The Libertas.eu member parties in the UK are "Pro-Democracy: Libertas.eu" and "Libertas Northern Ireland" Pre-existing national member parties were asked to change their names to include the word "Libertas" in the title. Members of member parties were members of Libertas automatically unless they chose otherwise.
